Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the role of the IRS in being "in charge" of a "huge national database" on health care that includes Americans' "personal, intimate, most close-to-the-vest-secrets."
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that the IRS will have access to a database containing such personal and intimate information.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the IRS will use personal and intimate information to deny or delay health care based on political beliefs, which is a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the purpose and control of the database, which the claim does not consider.
